45:59 Caption: We have seen a few chances and nice movements, but the overall impression of the game is rather average and not hugely entertaining. The hosts were superior in their performance in the first half. They were more active and precise. The home team tries to prevail using combination football, while the away teams uses mostly counter-attacks.

48:59 Caption: The fans must be pleased with the show they have seen on the pitch today. There was no chance to get bored as the game was very attractive. Let's hope the players won't lose their passion and determination in the future matches. Great display from the home side, you have to say that they were the better side today. The hosts displayed good teamplay with a lot of passes. The visiting side patiently waited in their own half to dispossess the opponent and hit them on the break.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In an enthralling fixture at Camp Nou, Barcelona hosted Alaves in what turned out to be a captivating matchup full of twists and excitement. Barcelona came into the game looking to extend their strong start to the season, whereas Alaves were aiming to build on their recent performances and cause an upset. The game commenced with high energy from the underdogs, as Alaves took the kick-off.

From the opening whistle, it was clear that this was going to be a highly competitive affair. The first few minutes were fairly uneventful as both teams sought to settle into their rhythm. A throw-in by Barcelona at the 28-second mark set the stage for what would be a contest defined by tactical battles and strategic plays. Barcelona appeared to be the aggressive side early on, trying to probe the Alaves defense, but an initial foul by Barcelona at the 3-minute mark highlighted their eagerness to regain possession quickly.

It wasn't long before Alaves started making their presence felt. Winning an indirect free kick four minutes in, they showcased early signs of promise. As the game continued into the fifth and sixth minutes, possession switched hands multiple times through throw-ins and clearances, illustrating just how equally matched the teams were in the opening exchanges.

Barcelona's Neymar was right in the thick of things, testing Alaves' defense with his inventive dribbling and attempts to break through. However, Alaves remained resolute, clearing the ball effectively each time Barca threatened. The game's first noteworthy shot on goal came in the 13th minute and it was delivered by Gomez Perez Ibai of Alaves. However, despite his powerful strike from just outside the box, it went straight at Barcelona's keeper, Jasper Cillessen, who managed a comfortable save.

In response, Barcelona ramped up their offensive efforts. A corner from Neymar in the 14th minute was anticipated but intercepted by Alaves, demonstrating their defensive solidity. Shortly after, Ivan Rakitic had a chance to put Barcelona ahead with a mid-range shot in the 17th minute, but his effort was too high and flew over the bar.

Alaves were also showing that they weren't in Barcelona merely to park the bus. In the 20th minute, Edgar Mendez tried his luck from distance, though his shot went wide off the right post, keeping Cillessen on his toes. As Barcelona refocused their offensive strategies, Neymar and Arda Turan tried to break through the Alaves defense by exchanging quick passes, but to no avail. Barcelona's Denis Suarez had a notable solo run into the box in the 22nd minute, but his effort went just over the top, summing up Barcelona’s early frustration.

Midway through the first half, Barcelona thought they’d found a breakthrough when Aleix Vidal connected with a cross in the penalty area, only to head the ball over the bar. Neymar continued weaving his magic but often found his crosses and passes effectively dealt with by Alaves' defensive line. By the 35th minute, despite Barcelona enjoying a superior possession, they were yet to break the deadlock.

It was Alaves who struck first blood. In the 38th minute, Deyverson found space inside the box to connect with a pass from Kiko and sent the ball low into the middle of the net, giving Alaves the lead to the astonishment of the Barcelona faithful. Barcelona reacted quickly but had to deal with their own missed opportunity when Neymar sent a header wide in the 39th minute, a miss that encapsulated the home side’s frustrations.

As the game approached halftime, Barcelona saw a goal ruled out for offside, adding to their woes. Still, the Blaugrana managed to maintain pressure up to the end of the first half, but couldn’t overcome the stoic Alaves defense. At the halftime whistle, Alaves carried their one-goal advantage into the break.

The second half began with immediate action and drama. Within a minute of the restart, Barcelona converted a corner into an equalizer. Neymar’s precise cross found Jeremy Mathieu who headed it low into the middle of the net, leveling the score at 1-1. The quick response galvanized Barcelona, who started dominating the proceedings.

Deyverson of Alaves had an effort saved comfortably by Cillessen shortly after their restart, but much of the second half saw Barcelona relentless in their pursuit of a winning goal. Opportunities kept coming for Barcelona; Jeremy Mathieu came close again in the 4th minute with a header that narrowly missed the right post.

Throughout the half, Neymar and the Barcelona attack continued to press, sending a barrage of crosses into Alaves' penalty area. The Brazilian himself saw a long-range effort sail over the crossbar in the 4th minute, while Paco Alcacer narrowly missed the target in the 6th. 

Alaves, however, had a game plan and stuck to it. Their defensive effort was coupled with decisive counter-attacks. In the 18th minute of the second half, Gomez Perez Ibai put Alaves back into the lead after a great solo run saw him slot the ball past Cillessen into the bottom right corner of the goal, making it 2-1 in favor of the visitors.

Barcelona threw everything into attack, seeking to draw level again. The introduction of Lionel Messi and Andres Iniesta to replace Denis Suarez and Arda Turan aimed to offer fresh legs and more creativity in the final third. Despite multiple attempts, including a promising free-kick by Messi and several corners taken by Neymar, the Alaves defense held firm.

With the clock ticking down, Barcelona created several clear cut chances. Andres Iniesta took a shot from the edge of the box that went wide, and Lionel Messi also dragged his shot wide in stoppage time. Despite the Blaugrana's intense pressure and dominant possession statistics, Alaves held on to their slender advantage.

The last minutes of the match saw frantic activity, with Barcelona pushing deep into Alaves' territory, seeking the all-important equalizer. However, Alaves showed commendable resilience, with their defense thwarting Barcelona's relentless waves of attack. Every clearance, every interception was cheered by the travelling Alaves fans, who were sensing a famous victory.

As the final whistle blew, it marked a significant victory for Alaves at one of Europe's toughest grounds. The fans at Camp Nou witnessed an intense match, full of action, tactical battles, and dramatic moments. Despite having more of the ball and creating more chances, Barcelona could not find a way past the determined Alaves defense in the dying minutes.

This match will be remembered for the persistence and tactical discipline of Alaves, who despite the odds, walked away with three crucial points. The team demonstrated that discipline, tactical awareness, and taking chances when they are presented can lead to triumph even against a giant like Barcelona. On the other hand, Barcelona, despite their attacking prowess and considerable talent, have a lesson to learn about converting possession and chances into goals. This loss might also indicate the depth and competitiveness in La Liga, where any team can spring surprises if they play to their strengths and remain resolute.

In reflection, the match was a testament to the thrilling unpredictability of football. The hosts may have dominated possession and chances created, but Alaves' clinical execution and stout defending were deservedly rewarded in the end. Both teams and their fans will look at this game as a significant chapter in their respective seasons, full of lessons, and experiences to carry forward.
